Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.Input

  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains helper methods to generate input for tests.
    Since:
    31.01.2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joshua Gleitze

    • Method Detail

      • getFile

        public static java.lang.String getFile(java.lang.String... lines)
        Returns a path to a file containing the lines given in lines. Creates the file if it was not created before.
        Parameters:
        lines - The lines to print in the file.
        Returns:
        path to a file containing lines

      • getFile

        public static java.lang.String getFile(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> lines)
        Returns a path to a file containing the lines given in lines. Creates the file if it was not created before.
        Parameters:
        lines - The lines to print in the file.
        Returns:
        path to a file containing lines

      • fileMessage

        public static java.lang.String fileMessage(java.lang.String[] commandLineArguments)
        A message giving information about the input file used in a test.
        Parameters:
        commandLineArguments - The command line arguments the main method was called with during the test. The file message will read the file name in the second argument and output the contents of the file its pointing to.
        Returns:
        A text representing the input file

      • isFile

        public static boolean isFile(java.lang.String fileName)

      • arrayToLines

        public static java.lang.String arrayToLines(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Converts an Array of Strings into a String where each array element is represented as one line.
        Parameters:
        lines - The array to process
        Returns:
        the array as lines.
